work_experience.name: Caliber Communications
bullet_points: Worked independently to create a number of tools and applications that lay the groundwork for real-time object detection on video streams at a large scale
Developed a command line tool in Python for training and benchmarking neural networks defined in Tensorflow
Created an Angular Web App for labelling objects within an image, and trained a team on the correct procedure for producing clean data
Wrote a REST API in Node.js to manage image datasets; labeling and verification of new images; and weights files, training, and benchmarks for neural network architectures
Designed and implemented an inference node as a scalable docker container that uses gRPC and a multiprocessing pipeline to handle inference requests

extra_info.text: Tensorflow, Keras, Numpy, OpenCV, Express, Angular, PostgreSQL

work_experience.name: Weever Apps
bullet_points: Worked along side the QA manager to ensure the stability and functionality of Weever Apps' products
Developed scripts and SQL queries to reduce the manual work required to deploy certain native apps by over 80%
Developed an automated testing suite in JavaScript using Selenium to meet a critical need for better frontend test coverage

Stood in as QA manager in the absence of the regular manager. During this time, held many extra responsibilities including being responsible for giving the final go-ahead on code pushes, and working with developers and project management to ensure deadlines were met

work_experience.name: Cathedral High School
bullet_points: Developed the prototype for a web app to gamify the creation of MLA and APA style citations as part of my grade 12 computer science course
Upon completion of the course, was hired part time by Cathedral's teacher-librarian to continue building the concept into a usable product
The app supports an admin panel which enables administrators to modify quiz content and allows teachers to view submissions from students in their class

work_experience.name: Venture
bullet_points: Encouraged grade 6-7 students to learn about computers and technology though hands-on investigation
Assisted students in the creation of their own projects using robotics and computer programming
Taught various classes to students including Intro to Programming with Python

community_involvement.name: McMaster CS Society
bullet_points: Volunteers as the Vice President - Academic for the Computer Science Society
Acts as a intermediary between Computer Science students and faculty
Heads an academic committee that works to enact initiatives pertaining to curriculum and academic student life
Runs academic events such as interview prep, midterm/exam study, and industry networking nights

community_involvement.name: HamOnt JS
bullet_points: Gave a talk detailing my experience developing a JavaScript based automated testing suite for Weever Apps
Discussed the merits of various frameworks and design patterns that can be used for automated testing in JavaScript

community_involvement.name: St. Patrick's Robotics Club
bullet_points: Volunteered at a local elementary school as a leader/mentor to an all-girls robotics team
Helped give students an understanding of programming through hands-on problem solving with LEGO Robotics

community_involvement.name: Hacking Health Hamilton
bullet_points: Attended the two-day Hacking Health Hamilton conference and worked with a team to develop a prototype of our solution to medication regimen compliance issues: MedKit
Won people's choice award for our prototype and presentation

personal_projects.name: Curtis Clicker
bullet_points: Developed a Computer Science themed "Cookie Clicker" web app for a course assignment
Created in Elm: a functional language that compiles into HTML and JavaScript
Uses Webpack to build into a static distributable

personal_projects.name: Citation Practice Web App
bullet_points: Created an Angular web app with REST backend to allow students to practice MLA citations
Features an administration panel for teachers to see results and statistics about the performance of their students
